name: Caddy
description: A web server and reverse proxy. As a reverse proxy, it directs all HTTP/HTTPS traffic directed to my server. Almost all other services rely on Caddy to proxy requests to them.

name: Vaultwarden
description: An alternative implementation of the Bitwarden server API written in Rust. Bitwarden is a password manager (it's also available on the App Store!).

name: Gitea
description: A community managed lightweight code hosting solution. It's like a lighter, self-hosted version of GitHub.

name: PrivateBin
description: A minimalist, open source online pastebin where the server has zero knowledge of pasted data. It uses end-to-end encryption to achieve this.

name: MkDocs
description: A static site generator that's geared towards building project documentation. I use it to document the project I'm describing in this playground!

name: Pi-hole
description: A network-wide ad blocker that works by acting as a DNS server.

name: WireGuard
description: A modern VPN protocol that I use to access my server from outside of my home.

name: Docker
description: A tool that allows you to run applications in containers, so that different applications and their dependencies are isolated.

name: OpenSSH
description: A utility that gives me Secure SHell (SSH) access to my server remotely, allowing me to administrate it from the outside.

name: FreshRSS
description: A self-hostable aggregator for RSS and Atom feeds. On my phone and computer, I use NetNewsWire (from the App Store) to login to my FreshRSS instance and get notifications for some feeds (e.g. updates to software I host, blogs, etc.).
